diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +102,106 @@      end_of_life_date:
        description:
          - >-
            The end of life date of the gallery Image Version. This property can
            be used for decommissioning purposes. This property is updatable.

comments.body:
@zikalino Just a quick question: is there a reason to check for None for snapshot but just check truthiness for managed_image?  The difference, coming right after each other is very noticable but there's no comment to indicate why that might have been done.  If there is a reason, a comment is probably appropriate.  If there isn't a reason, making them both the same will give future maintainers one less thing to worry about when they change it ;-)

This comment doesn't block the PR.  I'll go ahead and merge the backport now.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +371,375 @@            self.body['properties'].setdefault('storageProfile', {}).setdefault('osDiskImage', {}).setdefault('source', {})['id'] = snapshot
        managed_image = self.body.get('properties', {}).get('publishingProfile', {}).pop('managed_image', None)
        if managed_image:
            self.body['properties'].setdefault('storageProfile', {}).setdefault('source', {})['id'] = managed_image
